title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young orphan named Harry discovers his magical heritage and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: Matilda
author: Roald Dahl
description: Matilda is a bright young girl with extraordinary powers who contends with neglectful parents and a tyrannical headmistress.

title: Charlotte's Web
author: E.B. White
description: A pig named Wilbur is saved from certain death by a caring spider named Charlotte, who spins messages in her web.

title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
author: C.S. Lewis
description: Four siblings step through a wardrobe into a magical land called Narnia, ruled by an evil White Witch.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: In a small Southern town, Scout Finch learns about justice and prejudice as her father defends a Black man wrongly accused of a crime.

author: George Orwell
description: A haunting tale of a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance and propaganda to control its citizens.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates love, society, and family expectations in 19th-century England.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on a quest to help dwarves reclaim their homeland and discovers his own courage.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A young man named Holden Caulfield struggles with alienation and the phoniness of the adult world.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A mysterious millionaire named Jay Gatsby pursues wealth and love in the Jazz Age, with tragic consequences.
